tv.generator-info-name: Processed by Open-EPG Visual Processor v1.0

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Mother of three, Samantha Whyte is searching for the Swiss father she has never met. We also meet Vanda James, who is looking to put an end to a secret that has haunted her family for over fifty years.

programme.title: Gardening Australia
programme.desc: Tino Carnevale meets friends who met via a garden program, Costa Georgiadis builds a frog bog at a preschool, Sophie Thomson meets volunteers who have replanted a woodland and Jerry Coleby-Williams looks at volunteer plants.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across today. Presented by Kathryn Robinson.

programme.title: The Following Events Are Based On Lies
programme.sub-title: Act Three: Further Down the Rabbit Hole
programme.desc: Alice continues to build her case against Rob and meets another of his exes. She decides that, together, theyll be able to convince Cheryl just who Rob really is.

programme.title: Grand Designs Australia
programme.desc: At Rye on the Mornington Peninsula, Ryan plans to build a unique home, with boulders in the living room, and his bedroom in a cave.

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: We search on behalf of 50-year-old Deborah Ozturk, who has spent years longing to find her birth mother and thank her for the incredible sacrifice she made in giving her up as a baby.

programme.title: Gardening Australia
programme.sub-title: Spring: Backyard Habitat and Pruning Natives
programme.desc: Jane discovers a lush urban courtyard, Josh joins a research team tracking backyard biodiversity, Hannah explores a flourishing cottage garden, Millie tackles native maintenance, and we meet award-winning poultry breeders.

programme.title: Hard Quiz
programme.desc: Chasing after Tom Gleesons Big Brass Mug this week on Hard Quiz are experts in Suzi Quatro, multi-level marketing, The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe, and dirt. Yes, dirt!

programme.title: The Assembly
programme.desc: Leigh Sales hosts The Assembly, where she mentors Autistic journalist students as they interview legendary Aussie cook and businesswoman, Maggie Beer. (Final)

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Nikki and Jack continue to investigate the shocking lorry deaths.

programme.title: Rage Charts
programme.desc: Count down the hottest chart hits, and catch up on some of the most promising new popular music videos on rage.

programme.title: Rage
programme.desc: Keep the party vibe going every Saturday morning with wall-to-wall music videos, from classic hits and long-forgotten tracks from the rage vault, to the latest new releases and special features.

programme.title: ABC News At Noon
programme.desc: Melissa Mackay presents the latest from ABC News on the weekend bringing you todays top stories and coverage of events as they unfold. Plus original reporting, analysis and updated news, sport, weather and information.

programme.title: Professor T
programme.desc: After discovering the body of an undercover police officer, in the boot of a car, the CID team blunder into a Drugs Squad operation against a major trafficker that appears to implicate one of their closest colleagues. (Final)

programme.title: I Was Actually There
programme.desc: It was a move that shocked the nation. Fifty years ago, Prime Minister Gough Whitlam was dismissed by the Governor-General, Sir John Kerr. The government was dissolved and an election called.

programme.title: Return To Paradise
programme.desc: A tense game of lawn bowls turns to chaos when a player is killed on the green in broad daylight by an antique ornamental bushrangers gun. Is the ghost of Bushranger Bill haunting Dolphin Cove?

programme.title: Good Game Spawn Point
programme.sub-title: Chocobo Gp and Consoles Youve Never Heard Of
programme.desc: We review the bird-skating and kart racing action of Chocobo GP, plus we dig up a list of some of the most obscure game consoles youve probably never even heard of.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: Dr Xands been messing around with Dr Chris greenhouse and prize winning strawberries to show how your trachea works. The doctors get quizzed in Ouchology and meet three incredible Ouch Awards nominees.

programme.title: Star Wars: Young Jedi Adventures
programme.desc: Nubs tracks down a harvest taken by birds.

programme.title: The Ghastly Ghoul
programme.sub-title: The Horrible Haunted Hospital Of Dr. Phineas Phrag!
programme.desc: A little monster from Halloween World is stranded in the human world on Halloween Night after trick or treating too much, and its up to one girl to face her fears and help the monster return home.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: The heat winners in shows 1 to 5 come back to fight again. The judges must choose one Wild Card from the runners-up to join them. Every team left standing battles it out to make it to the grand final of Robot Wars.

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: Steve heads into the heart of the Suriname Jungle. He goes in search of poison dart frogs, deadly snakes and hopes to find the elusive giant river otter

programme.title: Dragon Ball Super
programme.sub-title: Despair Redux! The Return Of The Evil Emperor, Frieza!
programme.desc: The members of the Frieza Force have slowly been gathering to seek revenge for their fallen leader. While Goku and Vegeta train, Sorbet and his men head to Earth in search of the Dragon Balls and a way to bring back Frieza!

programme.title: Good Game Spawn Point
programme.sub-title: Moss: Book 2 And Jaxs Four Games To Never Forget
programme.desc: We jump back into the pint-sized world of the heroic mouse Quill in the virtual reality adventure Moss: Book 2, plus Jax shares four of the games that made him the gamer he is today.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: Dr Xand goes head to head with Dougie the dog in todays lab to show how your shoulders work, catch up with our Ouch Babies in their first weeks of life and meet triple jumper Naomi Ogbeta in Brilliant Bodies.

programme.title: Star Wars: Young Jedi Adventures
programme.desc: The Jedi must stop pirates from ruining Life Day.

programme.title: Hard Quiz Kids
programme.sub-title: Fungi, Ned Kelly, Charlie and the Chocolate Factory and Lin-Manuel Miranda
programme.desc: It takes all sorts, and Hard Quiz Kids is a big bag of liquorice! Vying for Tom Gleesons Big Brass Mug are experts on fungi, Ned Kelly, Charlie and the Chocolate Factory, and Lin-Manuel Miranda.

programme.title: Abbott Elementary
programme.desc: When the students start participating in a new online trend that causes disruption to the school, the teachers band together to put an end to it.

programme.title: Pokemon: Diamond And Pearl
programme.desc: As our heroes help treasure-hunter Cheryl with her quest for the Enchanted Honey, they meet a Trainer named Gardenia who adores Grass-type Pokemon.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!: Do Try This At Home
programme.desc: A camera pill shows Dr Chris digestive system at work squidging food, and get ready to make your own fake stomach!

programme.title: Rage Charts
programme.desc: Count down the hottest chart hits and catch up on some of the most promising new popular music videos on rage.

programme.title: The Stand Up Sketch Show
programme.desc: Breakneck comedy show packed with stand-up routines from top comics, brought to life in sketch form. Featuring Rhys James, Helen Bauer, Gbemi Oladipo, Paddy Young and Esther Manito.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: The doctors fill their bladders - quite literally - to show what happens when you go for a wee. Dr Chris meets a robot that can zap bad cells, and Dr Xand is in the Ouch-Mobile ready for more medical mysteries.

programme.title: 100% Wolf: Legend Of The Moonstone
programme.desc: Its the first day of school, and Freddy immediately comes into conflict with bully Ivan, who blackmails him into stealing the sacred moonstone! But when Batty is exposed to the moonstone, shes turned into a human girl!

programme.title: We Bare Bears
programme.desc: Charlie hosts an evening of spooky stories.

programme.title: The Strange Chores
programme.desc: Defending the house on Halloween, Charlies in for a fright when Pierce invites the neighbourhood (and at least one monster) over for a costume party. They must trick the gatecrasher to reveal itself before it gets its treat!

programme.title: Teen Titans Go!
programme.desc: Raven tries to put the spirit of Halloween back in Halloween.

programme.title: Teen Titans Go!
programme.desc: The Titans want to be the scariest trick-or-treaters in town, so Raven casts a spell that turns them into real monsters.

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent Specials
programme.desc: Phils going undercover in the East Midlands where, latest figures show, it takes longer to sell your house than anywhere else in England. (Final)

programme.title: Ride Like A Girl
programme.desc: The story of Michelle Payne, the first female jockey to win the Melbourne Cup. After early failures, a family tragedy and a near-fatal horse fall, Michelle beat the odds to ride Prince of Penzance into the history books.

programme.title: rage Vault Guest Programmer: Animal Collective
programme.desc: Riding high on the success of Merriweather Post Pavilion, Baltimores own Animal Collective brought their kaleidoscopic taste to rage back in 2010.

programme.title: The Babadook
programme.desc: A struggling single mother and her child descend into a state of paranoia when they discover an ominous childrens book has mysteriously appeared in their home.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: The doctors try to trick their body temperatures, the Ouch-Mobile is open for more intriguing medical mysteries, and Dr Xand tries to stop his body giving him away when he tells fibs in a lie detector test.

programme.title: 100% Wolf: Legend Of The Moonstone
programme.desc: Freddy attempts to teach Batty how to be human while searching for a cure for her new human form. A class assignment to capture the mysterious Golden Horn and prove who the alpha wolf is goes awry when a wilderwolf attacks!

programme.title: Scooby-Doo And Guess Who?
programme.sub-title: The Phantom, The Talking Dog And The Hot Hot Hot Sauce!
programme.desc: The gang heads to Nashville, Tennessee to meet up with country music legend Kacey Musgraves!

programme.title: Moon And Me
programme.desc: Inside the Little Toy House, Colly Wobble discovers a toy suitcase. In Storyland, Colly Wobble decides to take her suitcase on a journey far away.

programme.title: Beep And Mort
programme.desc: Olive wants to try ice skating, but Clem says its not safe while holding her blankie. But blankie goes with her everywhere! So Mort tells Olive the story of the mollybird who didnt want to hatch from her egg.

programme.title: Hoopla Doopla!
programme.desc: Mimi is so tired she needs a holiday but cant decide where to go. So her friends take her on three pretend holidays to help her choose.

programme.title: The Sound Collector
programme.desc: The Sound Collector listens to the wonderful sound of a piano from inside and out.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing and Sula enjoy painting a giant mural at Ammas nursery until Bings enthusiastic rainbow painting makes paint run all over Sulas beautiful tree.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa has a new pen pal in France, named Delphine. Peppa speaks to her on the telephone. Although Peppa speaks English and Delphine French, they discover that they love lots of the same things, especially muddy puddles.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: Its almost time for the ice cream van to pay its daily visit and Bitzer has his heart set on a well-earned treat. However, his work is not done - theres a whole list of chores standing in his way.

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Supertato runs in fright when Pumpkin tries to make friends with him, but he later realises she needs his help as shes stuck in the air hanging from balloons set up by Evil Pea.

programme.title: Mojo Swoptops
programme.desc: Is there really a ghost at Jacksons pumpkin patch? Mojo and Bo need to find out!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: The children decorate the clubhouse to make it scary for Halloween but not too scary. The kids give the grownups a tour and thy pretend to be scared but the kids reassure them its not too scary.

programme.title: Ginger And The Vegesaurs
programme.desc: Ginger and the baby Pea-Rexes have their plans thwarted when a large Pumpkinsaurus blocks their way into the Spooky Forest.

programme.title: Super Monsters
programme.desc: The Super Monsters Halloween fun turns chaotic, but by taking responsibility and working together, they fix their mistakes and make Halloween unforgettable.

programme.title: Stan Can
programme.desc: Stanley must keep Myrtles pumpkin safe from Speedy the snail.

programme.title: The Sound Collector
programme.desc: Mole prefers treats to tricks at Halloween. The Sound Collector follows on her trail.

programme.title: Play School Science Time
programme.desc: Can we create our own geodes? Dr Tara Djokic teaches Matt all about magnificent geodes and together they create their own geodes using empty eggshells.

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: The spooky hijinx continues as Orticia gets carried away by tricking, not treating - resulting in (mild) Halloween horror.

programme.title: Fizzy And Suds
programme.desc: Fizzy and Suds meet the cutest kittens and discover the super powers of our furry friends! Cats come in many colors and sizes, and all kinds of beautiful fur. But check this out - some dont have any fur at all!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and her family have landed in Italy, where they discover another spoken language. Daddy Pig finds driving around a little hard. Peppa rings Granny and Grandpa Pig to check are looking after Goldie the Fish.

programme.title: Millie Magnificent
programme.desc: After helping everyone else with their jack-o-lanterns, Millie finally settles on building a Millie-O-Lantern for Pumpkinfest in the Park.

programme.title: Builder Brothers Dream Factory
programme.desc: While working on a comic book of his childhood Cree stories, Mikisew tells the Dream Factory Crew about his tree fort and inspires them to hunt for the lost hang out.

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.sub-title: The Octonauts And The Scary Spookfish
programme.desc: The Octonauts try to pull Peso out of an oceanic trench and get some help from a strange-looking creature with a see-through head - a Spookfish.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The Squirrels are working together to find Enid when they notice that she is at the top of the Mighty Sugar Bun Mountain.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends: Big World! Big Adventures!
programme.desc: Thomas causes confusion and delay by not seeking help when he makes a mistake.

programme.title: Gardening Australia Junior
programme.desc: Hannah takes the kids to Kimbriki Tip to find some items suitable for making a garden out of refuse. They make a flower bed from an old pram, some oars and a wheelbarrow.

programme.title: Wiggle And Learn
programme.desc: Get ready for some Halloween fun! Sing, dress Up and enjoy your favourite Halloween songs, plus some craft-time fun!

programme.title: Tish Tash
programme.desc: Rosa asks Tish what she wants to be for Halloween, but Tish still isnt sure, and is having a hard time deciding.

programme.title: Ariel
programme.desc: Ursulas spooky mirror traps everyone.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: It is the first day in their holiday villa, Peppa and her family go exploring to the local village where there is pizza to eat, presents to buy and a post card to be sent to Goldie the Fish.

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: When Newton turns his back on his space powers, Luna exploits him to get back to the moon.

programme.title: The Adventures Of Paddington
programme.desc: Its Halloween and Paddington goes Treat or Treating with Jonathan and Judy around Windsor Gardens, but Mr Curry does not want to join in... or does he? And why is Mrs Bird not scared at all?

programme.title: Moon And Me
programme.desc: Inside the Little Toy House, everybody is surprised to discover the Roundabout has been left in the sitting room. In Storyland, Little Nana and Lambkin go flying in the aeroplane.

programme.title: Beep And Mort
programme.desc: Everyone has an idea for building sandy sculptures at the beach. Except for Mort, who cant think of anything! When he discovers magical fossil shapes in the cave, he uses his imagination to create the perfect idea.

programme.title: Hoopla Doopla!
programme.desc: Squidgie is always giving presents to her friends. So they decide they should do something to show how grateful they are by organising a special present for Squidgie.

programme.title: The Sound Collector
programme.desc: The seaside is a great place to find sounds, playing a seashell can even call a Mole!

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing and Flop play hide and seek on the way to Padgets shop. Bing doesnt want the game to end when they get there so he hides behind the door to the stock room, where Flop really cant see him.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George are helping Granny and Grandpa Pig tidy their attic. Although the attic is very full, deciding what to keep and what to throw out is quite hard since Granny and Grandpa want to keep everything.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: The Farmer becomes annoyed when a crow begins to create mayhem across the farm. Bitzer disguises himself as a scarecrow, but needs help from Shaun to make the problem disappear.

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Supertatos dancing is too powerful and destructive, but when he has to face Evil Pea in a dance-off to save his trapped friends, he soon realises his moves can save the day.

programme.title: Isadora Moon
programme.desc: Isadora and Zoe are partners in a school cake baking competition. Zoe, desperate to win talks Isadora into using magic to make a magnificent, magical winning cake.

programme.title: Super Monsters
programme.desc: Dracs flying mishap and Katyas broomstick fear teach the Super Monsters valuable lessons on teamwork, resilience, and facing challenges together.

programme.title: Mecha Builders
programme.desc: The Mechas have to help when a slide sends people all the way across the farm, where they spend more time walking than sliding.

programme.title: Isadora Moon: Isadora Moons Winter Magic
programme.desc: Isadoras Aunt Crystal, a winter fairy, brings Isadoras snow friend, Gordie to life. When he starts melting, they go on an adventure to the land of Snow and Ice where they meet the Snow Queen.

programme.title: Andy And The Band
programme.desc: Odd Sock Georgia cant get her PE kit from a strange lost property cupboard at school, so Andy and the Band take on a daring and delicate operation to retrieve it.

programme.title: Play School Science Time
programme.desc: Why do some bubbles pop and not others? Professor Bubbles is an expert in bubbles! Using his special formula, Leah and Professor Bubbles make their own brilliant bubbles to test what makes bubbles pop!

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: Whilst exploring deep space, a meteor strikes Cosima and Dads ship! Crash-landing on the unexplored planet of Proxima, Cosima makes a new best friend - Big Lizard!

programme.title: Builder Brothers Dream Factory
programme.desc: When Drews dance partner is unable to perform at the school talent show, the Dream Factory Crew equips Jonathan with programmed dancing shoes to act as a replacement. But the shoes go haywire!

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.sub-title: The Octonauts And The Slime Eels
programme.desc: Kwazii covets the treasure in a sunken pirate ship - but its protected by slime-squirting Slime Eels.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The squirrels discover the wonderful world of accessorising!

programme.title: Thomas And Friends: Big World! Big Adventures!
programme.desc: Raul wants a chance to beat Thomas in a game, but his super-competitive nature soon gets him into trouble.

programme.title: Millie Magnificent
programme.desc: When Maya shows Millie and Ben her new ship-in-a-bottle, Captain Millie gets it in her head to build a real sailboat in her backyard.

programme.title: Gardening Australia Junior
programme.desc: Costa and the kids visit a school who have reclaimed a block of land and regenerating it with local, native plants and trees. They need some help weeding and planting.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: George has fun looking at himself in the mirror. Peppa and George try to find other shiny things to see themselves in.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Blueys backyard zoo is home to wonderful animals, especially the big blue Daddy Gorilla. But when he grabs visitor Bingo and escapes, Zookeeper Bluey must recapture the wild beast.

programme.title: Steve and Aneeshwar Go Wild
programme.desc: Steve and Aneeshwar meet the worlds largest and heaviest lizard, the Komodo dragon, and lay a trail for him to find food. Then they meet a chameleon who has a very long tongue.

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Mother of three, Samantha Whyte is searching for the Swiss father she has never met. We also meet Vanda James, who is looking to put an end to a secret that has haunted her family for over fifty years.

programme.desc: Tino Carnevale meets friends who met via a garden program, Costa Georgiadis builds a frog bog at a preschool, Sophie Thomson meets volunteers who have replanted a woodland and Jerry Coleby-Williams looks at volunteer plants.

programme.title: Landline
programme.desc: A world-first mRNA vaccine for Foot-and-mouth disease; and a new all-natural fabric that combines wool with cotton.

Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus analysis from 7.30s Political Editor Jacob Greber.

programme.title: The Business
programme.desc: Australias leading daily business and finance show, bringing you up to date on market moves, economic trends and the forces affecting consumers, investors, employees and businesses big and small. Presented by Alicia Barry.

programme.title: ABC News Day
programme.desc: As every story unfolds, catch each breaking moment and stay up to date. Lorna Dunkley brings you todays top stories and the news as it unfolds, including the latest from the APEC Leaders Summit in Gyeongju, South Korea.

programme.title: Afternoon Briefing
programme.desc: Patricia Karvelas brings you the latest in politics, national and global affairs, speaking with politicians, commentators, journalists and expert observers on the week in parliament and the APEC Leaders Summit in South Korea.

programme.title: ABC News Hour
programme.desc: Stay in the know with Australias trusted news source. From your neighbourhood, across the country and around the world, ABC News bring you the days top stories and latest news, all verified. Presented by Joe OBrien.

programme.title: ABC Evening News
programme.desc: When you need to know whats going on across the country and around the globe, turn to Joe OBrien for a comprehensive roundup of the days news plus original reporting on the issues that affect you.

programme.title: ABC News Tonight
programme.desc: Manny Tsigas brings you the latest headlines and a brief summary of the days top stories from ABC News.

programme.title: Close Of Business
programme.desc: Inflation came in much hotter than economists were expecting, with consumer prices rising at an annual pace of 3.2%, up from 2.1% in the June quarter, dampening hopes of an interest rate cut on Melbourne Cup Day next week.

programme.title: Asia News Week
programme.desc: Yvonne Yong brings you a weekly roundup of the stories making news across the Asia region, plus whats trending on social media and making an impact on the culture and the way people live.

programme.title: The Breakfast Couch
programme.desc: Bridget, James, Emma and the team chat with 5 Seconds of Summer, bestselling author Matthew Reilly, natural history illustrator Sami Bayly, Peking Duk musician turned DJ Reuben Styles AKA DJ YOGA, and film critic Zak Hepburn.

programme.title: Planet America: Weekend Edition
programme.desc: Chas and John cover next weeks 2025 state elections in Virginia, New Jersey and New York, the NYC Mayoral race, Californias Proposition 50, will Trump run for a third term in 2028, and why are US politicians so old?

programme.title: Close Of Business
programme.desc: Inflation came in much hotter than economists were expecting, with consumer prices rising at an annual pace of 3.2%, up from 2.1% in the June quarter, dampening hopes of an interest rate cut on Melbourne Cup Day next week.

programme.title: DW Focus On Europe
programme.desc: How are people in Spain recovering one year after the deadly floods? Plus why are so many French people angry at President Macron?

programme.title: Media Watch
programme.desc: Albos Trump success was a surprise for those who anticipated failure. An electronics company doing under the table deals with online reviewers. A Swisse supplement story revealed to be a mea culpa to an unhappy advertiser.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: ABC Evening News
programme.desc: For the latest news as it happens ABC News is the home of breaking news, compelling stories and Australias best investigative journalism. Round the clock coverage of the news that matters to you from the team you can trust.

programme.title: ABC National News
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time for transparency and trust. ABC News brings you the days top stories and latest news with more reporters to tell you whats going on and why it matters. Presented by Mariam Saab.

programme.title: ABC News Tonight
programme.desc: Mariam Saab brings you the latest headlines and a brief summary of the days top stories from ABC News.

programme.title: ABC Nightly News
programme.desc: Wherever you are and whenever you need us, ABC News is here to bring you round the clock coverage of the latest news and todays stories. Plus reporters investigating issues that matter to you. Presented by Mariam Saab.

programme.title: ABC Late News Weekend
programme.desc: When you need to know whats happening turn to ABC News for coverage you can trust. We bring you the days events from reporters across Australia, connecting communities and telling your stories. Presented by Mariam Saab.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: Live across Australia, the latest headlines and the days top stories from ABC News. We have reporters on the ground connecting communities, telling your stories and bringing you coverage of whats happening as it unfolds.
